subject: Re: [junit] excluded.properties, location?
msgSnippet: ... Just to clarify a bit (since I had problems with this when I did it a while ago), you need to put the directory that contains
messageBody:
"Joi Ellis" <joi@...> wrote:
> On Fri, 4 May 2001, Lucas Filz wrote:
>
> > Dear Joi,
> >
> > thank you for your answer!
> > Where does JUnit look for the file 'excluded.properties' ?
> >
> > > From package junit/util:
>
> It looks in the classpath, package junit.util.excluded.properties.
> On disk this would be junit/util/excluded.properties. It's in the
> junit jar file, but you can override it by creating your own
> junit/util/excluded.properties file somewhere else and putting that
> in your classpath prior to the junit.jar file.

Just to clarify a bit (since I had problems with this when I did it a while
ago), you need to put the directory that contains
"/junit/util/excluded.properties" in your classpath.

For example, if you had "/home/java/junit/util/excluded.properties", you'd add
"/home/java" to your classpath.


Erik
